ACT
114
Recall
The assignor has the right to revoke the contract of assignment and distribution with respect to a specific descendant or spouse and to demand that he return what he received through the assignment and distribution, under the conditions under which he could revoke the donation made to him.
The transferor has the same right if the descendant or spouse does not provide him or anyone else with maintenance determined by the work of assignment and distribution, or if he does not pay the transferor's debts, the payment of which was ordered by the same work.
In other cases of non-fulfilment of the obligations assumed by the contract on assignment and distribution, the court, taking into account the importance of this for the assignor and other circumstances of the case, will decide whether the assignor has the right to demand the return of what was given or only to demand fulfillment.
